alert.note: Alert for Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jackson County Below 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 25 at 11:59PM MST until December 26 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT TRAVEL IMPACTS EXPECTED WITH QUICK HITTING STORM SUNDAY... .A fast moving storm system will bring hazardous travel conditions to the mountains on Sunday. Snow will develop late tonight and Sunday morning, and may then become heavy at times by early afternoon Sunday. Strong winds and considerable blowing snow will combine with the falling snow to produce blizzard or near blizzard conditions at times early to mid afternoon Sunday. Road closures will be possible. Snow will decrease by late afternoon or early evening, but slick roads, lighter snow, and areas of blowing snow will continue through Sunday night. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph producing areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...North Park, and Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet. * WHEN...From 5 AM to 5 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions along with areas of poor visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jackson County Below 9000 Feet
